channel.title: (idea) how to add sound for zones. (idea)
channel.description:
hey guys, this is an idea i have had and cannot program because im a modeler... the idea is that, to put sound into a client, you use the safe/wild zones. but instead of makeing it safe, you make it so the client plays a music track when you walk into that aera...
thanks for reading =)
shrogg

item.title: (idea) how to add sound for zones. (idea)
item.dc:creator: @cc987 cc987
item.description:
@cc987 wrote:

[quote=“Cramer, post:17, topic:258564”]Now…once I put my sounds on, it IS possible for the players to individually mute them correct? I mean without having to mute their speakers?[/quote] If runescape can do it so can we.

Read full topic

item.title: (idea) how to add sound for zones. (idea)
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

[quote=“noobie22, post:15, topic:258564”]So like…

case songid:

           absX = ####;
           absY = ####;
                break;

[/quote]

That’d only play if you were in that EXACT spot. It’d stop sending if you moved +X, +Y, -X, or -Y.

Read full topic

item.title: (idea) how to add sound for zones. (idea)
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

this was done in early 2006 :), you use the music packet (header 74,76 as I recall) . As I recall I had the server keep track of the map chunk and simply send a different song id for each chunk. you could easily do a more specific track change by checking the players coordinates and seeing if it falls into the area of effect. Just remember to stop the checking once it enters the zone or it will keep resending the packet.

Read full topic
item.source: (idea) how to add sound for zones. (idea)

item.title: (idea) how to add sound for zones. (idea)
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

m.dog311:

Does it matter if it’s 317 or 508? This could easily be done through packets

508’s are coded a bit differently and I don’t know about them, but you can possibly modify a 317’s packets and do this.
